decks.notes: The primary idea of this deck is to control the board by using a combination of cheap creatures and powerful enchantments, while also utilizing gates to fix mana. The deck focuses on card advantage through draw spells like Brainstorm and Squadron Hawk, as well as disruption with counterspells and removal spells like Journey to Nowhere. The Gates provide additional utility by tapping for multiple colors of mana and preventing damage with Prismatic Strands. Overall, the deck aims to stall the game until it can establish a dominant board presence and win the game.

The core idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using cheap aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence by playing efficient creatures like Squadron Hawk and Battle Screech, while also using removal spells like Lightning Bolt to clear the way for attacks. The deck also utilizes card draw and token generation to maintain momentum and put pressure on the opponent. The mana base is designed to consistently cast the spells and enable a fast start.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying small creatures like Lunarch Veteran, Squadron Hawk, and Thraben Inspector to pressure the opponent. With a mix of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and combat tricks like Thraben Charm, the deck aims to keep the pressure up while protecting its creatures with cards like Prismatic Strands. The deck also utilizes token generators like Battle Screech and Rally the Peasants to go wide and overwhelm opponents. With a solid curve and card advantage from Faithless Looting and Thrilling Discovery, this deck aims to outpace and outvalue opponents in the early game.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering spells, removing threats, and controlling the board with efficient creatures like Gurmag Angler. The deck also utilizes card draw and filtering effects to maintain card advantage and dig for key pieces. By utilizing a mix of removal, counter spells, and card draw, this deck aims to outlast its opponent while slowly building towards a win condition, using resources efficiently to maintain control of the game.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying cheap artifact creatures, benefiting from their synergies with cards like Refurbished Familiar and Reckoner's Bargain. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of efficient threats like Myr Enforcer and deal additional damage with Burn spells like Galvanic Blast. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Nihil Spellbomb and Krark-Clan Shaman. With a mix of card draw, removal, and aggressive creatures, the deck aims to maintain pressure and outpace the opponent in the Pauper 1 vs 1 format.

This Orzhov Aggro deck focuses on utilizing low-cost creatures and disruptive spells to pressure opponents quickly. By combining efficient creatures like Thraben Inspector and Glint Hawk with removal spells like Cast Down and Suffocating Fumes, the deck aims to control the board and reduce the opponent's life total as fast as possible. The inclusion of card draw and recursion through Grim Bauble and Omen of the Dead allows for flexibility and resilience in longer games. The deck also utilizes artifact lands and artifact creatures for additional synergy and mana fixing.

The deck focuses on using Persistent Petitioners to mill the opponent's library while generating value with other creatures and spells. It also includes cards like Gnaw to the Bone to provide resilience and Winding Way to help dig through the deck for more Petitioners. The lands provide a mix of blue and green mana sources to help cast the various spells in the deck. The strategy revolves around overwhelming the opponent with a consistent stream of milling and creature presence to secure victory.

The main concept of this UR Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's gameplan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Skred, and card draw/filtering with Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain. Creatures like Tolarian Terror and Murmuring Mystic provide additional threats, while cards like Spell Pierce and Lose Focus help protect your own spells. The deck utilizes a mix of Snow-Covered Islands and Mountains for mana base, alongside utility lands like Volatile Fjord and Seething Landscape to ensure consistent mana production.

The main focus of this deck is to use cards like Balustrade Spy to mill cards from your own library, while also utilizing cards like Dread Return to bring back key creatures from the graveyard. This allows for a powerful combo strategy that can overwhelm your opponent quickly. The deck also includes cards like Generous Ent and Sagu Wildling to provide additional support and resources. Additionally, cards like Lead the Stampede and Winding Way help to maintain card advantage and keep your strategy going strong. Overall, this deck is designed to efficiently execute a combo strategy and outpace your opponent.

The main focus of this Pauper 1 vs 1 Boros Aggro deck is to flood the board with low-cost creatures like Lunarch Veteran, Novice Inspector, and Squadron Hawk, while using cards like Lightning Bolt and Prismatic Strands for removal and protection. The deck also includes pump spells like Rally the Peasants and Thraben Charm to push through damage, along with card advantage from cards like Battle Screech and Faithless Looting. The mana base is built around Boros Garrison and Perilous Landscape to ensure consistent colors and smooth gameplay.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and evasive creatures. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while gradually gaining advantage with card draw and card advantage. The deck focuses on efficiently dealing with threats while maintaining a steady stream of resources. The key strategy revolves around leveraging the synergies between cheap spells, card selection, and efficient creatures to outvalue the opponent and eventually secure a win through attrition.

The main idea of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy with a combination of counter spells, removal, and creatures with disruptive abilities. The deck aims to control the board through countering threats, removing creatures, and generating card advantage with cards like Lórien Revealed and Augur of Bolas. The deck also includes evasive creatures like Ninja of the Deep Hours and Spellstutter Sprite to pressure the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Thorn of the Black Rose and Murmuring Mystic provides additional value and ways to generate card advantage.

This deck focuses on controlling the game with cards like God-Pharaoh's Faithful and Mulldrifter, while using Ephemerate to gain value and recur key spells. The deck utilizes efficient card draw through cards like Snap and Deep Analysis, and also has protection with counter spells like Foil. The key strategy is to out-value the opponent with powerful creatures and spells, while disrupting their game plan with control elements. The deck aims to grind out a win by generating value and controlling the board until it can overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using cheap creatures like Kessig Flamebreather and Sneaky Snacker, while also benefiting from spells like Fiery Temper, Lightning Bolt, and Fireblast to burn them down. Card advantage is gained through Faithless Looting and Grab the Prize, while Highway Robbery can provide a big burst of mana for explosive plays. The overall goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast damage and finish them off with direct burn spells before they can establish a defense.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using low-cost creatures and ramp spells to quickly build a strong board presence. The deck aims to utilize cards like Arbor Elf, Nyxborn Hydra, and Ram Through to put pressure on the opponent and finish them off quickly before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Utopia Sprawl and Wild Growth help to accelerate mana production, allowing the deck to play multiple threats in a single turn and maintain a consistent stream of aggression.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and burn spells. It utilizes efficient creatures like Burning-Tree Emissary and Goblin Bushwhacker to quickly build a board presence, while also using burn spells like Galvanic Blast and Lightning Bolt to remove blockers or finish off opponents. The deck can also take advantage of sacrificing creatures with Fireblast and Reckless Abandon for extra damage. Rally at the Hornburg can provide a large boost to the team's attacks, allowing for a swift victory.
